alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden; Coastal Ocean; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:50AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Atlantic, central Ocean, southeastern Camden and Burlington Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 450 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Penn State Forest, or 22 miles southwest of Toms River, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Evesham, Medford, Barnegat, Hammonton, Lumberton, Mount Holly, Berlin, Tabernacle, Shamong, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Presidential Lakes Estates, Chesilhurst, Pemberton, Surf City, Port Republic, Wrightstown, Atsion, Leisuretowne and Jacksonville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 5. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 49 and 52. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 47 and 75. Atlantic City Expressway near mile marker 35, and between mile markers 37 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Camden; Coastal Ocean; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington
